    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static int sum​(Node start)
        DO NOT MODIFY - provided as a sample for traversal
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        sum of all items starting at Node start FOR EXAMPLE, if start.data = 20 and start.next refers to another Node (say b) such that b.data = 50 and b.next refers to another Node (say c) such that c.data = 10 and c.next is null we represent this as: start represents [20, 50, 10] in this case, the method should return 80

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString​(Node start)

      • sumOdd

        public static int sumOdd​(Node start)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        sum of all odd numbers

      • count

        public static int count​(Node start)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        number of non-null Nodes starting at Node start. For example if start represents [10, 70, 20, 90] return 4

      • countPositives

        public static int countPositives​(Node start)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        number of positive numbers

      • countPrimes

        public static int countPrimes​(Node start)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        number of prime numbers The method isPrime is provided in class MathService and can be called as: MathService.isPrime(number to check)

      • getFirstPositiveNode

        public static Node getFirstPositiveNode​(Node start)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
        the first Node starting at Node start containing a positive data value return null if no Node containing a positive data value for example, if start represents [-5, 0, 6, 2, -8, 0] and the Node returned is result, then result represents [6, 2, -8]

      • identical

        public static boolean identical​(Node start1,
                                Node start2)
        Parameters:
        start1 -
        start2 -
        Returns:
        true if sequence of items starting at Nodes start1 and start2 have the same items in the same order FOR EXAMPLE, if start1 represents [10, 70, 20, 90] start2 represents [10, 70, 20, 90] return true if start1 represents [10, 70, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return false if start1 represents [10, 60, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return false if start1 represents [10, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return false if start1 represents [10, 20, 90] start2 represents [10, 20] return false

      • join

        public static Node join​(Node start1,
                        Node start2)
        Parameters:
        start1 -
        start2 -
        Returns:
        Node object starting a sequence of items from start1 followed by all items of start2 FOR EXAMPLE: if start1 represents [10, 70, 20] start2 represents [50, 90] then if the returned object is result, result represents [10, 70, 20, 50, 90]

      • subList

        public static Node subList​(Node start,
                           int idx1,
                           int idx2)
        start.data is considered to be item at index 0 start.next.data is considered to be item at index 1 start.next.next.data is considered to be item at index 2 and so on...
        Parameters:
        start -
        idx1 -
        idx2 -
        Returns:
        Node that starts a sequence of items from index idx1 to index idx2 (inclusive on both sides) in items beginning at Node start, if valid. return null if the range is invalid. FOR EXAMPLE: If start represents [10, 70, 20, 50, 90, 30, 80] idx1 = 2 idx2 = 5 then for the returned object, start represents [20, 50, 90, 30]

      • same

        public static boolean same​(Node start1,
                           Node start2)
        Parameters:
        start1 -
        start2 -
        Returns:
        true if items starting at Nodes start1 and start2 are the same (ok to be in different order) FOR EXAMPLE, if start1 represents [10, 70, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return true if start1 represents [10, 60, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return false if start1 represents [10, 20, 90] start2 represents [90, 10, 20, 70] return false if start1 represents [10, 20, 90] start2 represents [10, 20] return false

      • addAscending

        public static Node addAscending​(Node start,
                                int value)
        Parameters:
        start - : assume the sequence of nodes starting at Node start are in ascending order
        value -
        Returns:
        reference to the first Node at which the sorted sequence starts add a node containing value in the sequence of nodes starting at Node start such that the sequence of nodes starting at Node start are STILL in ascending order

      • addDescending

        public static Node addDescending​(Node start,
                                 int value)
        Parameters:
        start - : assume the sequence of nodes starting at Node start are in descending order
        value -
        Returns:
        reference to the first Node at which the sorted sequence starts add a node containing value in the sequence of nodes starting at Node start such that the sequence of nodes starting at Node start are STILL in descending order

      • sort

        public static Node sort​(Node start,
                        boolean asc)
        sort the nodes starting at Node start in ascending order if asc = true, otherwise sort in descending order
        Parameters:
        start -
        asc -
        Returns:
        reference to the first Node at which the sorted sequence starts
